alert.note: Alert for Custer; Fallon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 3:33PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following counties, Custer and Fallon. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell. While the strongest storms have moved out of the area, additional light showers will continue over the advisory area. Therefore, additional light accumulations are still expected. Portions of Cabin Creek, Pennel Creek, O-Fallon Creek, and Sandstone Creek may still see rises in flow from the rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ismay and Westmore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
